description:
• Has three release cycles:
- [Stable release](https://www.debian.org/releases/stretch/)
- [Testing release](https://www.debian.org/devel/testing) (not recommended for use)
- [Unstable (sid) release](https://www.debian.org/releases/sid/) (not recommended for use)
• Uses the apt package manager which is relatively intuitive and works well under most situations.
• Ubuntu is based on Debian, but Ubuntu is generally much more up to date and has many other benefits.
• Debian is not recommended for use over Ubuntu.
- Ubuntu has an optional rolling kernel.
- Ubuntu has PPAs (extra repos for Debian are very rare).
- Ubuntu has very easy driver installs (easier than Windows in most cases).
- Most games are tested for the latest LTS of Ubuntu.
- Most software is packaged for Ubuntu.
- Ubuntu offers a [Minimal Installation ISO](https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Installation/MinimalCD) which can be used for a very minimal Ubuntu install with a choice of Desktop Environment.

See `sudo info recommended` and `sudo info ubuntu` for more information on Ubuntu and recommended Ubuntu flavors.

[Download Debian](https://www.debian.org/distrib/)
